data.title: Top 10 Best Engineering Colleges in Pune 2024
data.meta_description: Top 10 Best Engineering Colleges in Pune 2024. 1. College of Engineering, Pune 2. Army Institute of Technology, Pune 3. MIT World Peace University, Pune
data.text:
The National Institutional Ranking Framework (NIRF) ranks educational institutions in India based on various parameters. In 2024, the top engineering colleges in Pune have been evaluated on these standards, showcasing their excellence in education, research, and overall student development. Below is a table of the top colleges in Pune along with their NIRF scores and rankings.

According to NIRF ranking the best college in Pune in 2024 is College of Engineering, Pune (COEP).

Top Rankings 2024

The NIRF rankings are based on a variety of parameters, ensuring a comprehensive evaluation of each institution.

The key parameters include:

Teaching, Learning & Resources (TLR): Evaluates the institution’s infrastructure, faculty, and learning resources.

Research and Professional Practice (RP): Considers the quality and quantity of research output, patents, and professional practices.

Graduation Outcomes (GO): Assesses the employability and placement statistics of graduates.

Outreach and Inclusivity (OI): Measures the inclusivity of the institution, considering factors like gender diversity and outreach to rural students.

Perception (PR): Gauges the overall perception of the institution among academics, employers, and the public.

Individual College Details

College of Engineering, Pune (COEP)

College of Engineering, Pune, is one of the oldest engineering colleges in India. Established in 1854, it has a rich history of producing eminent engineers. The college offers undergraduate, postgraduate, and doctoral programs in various disciplines of engineering. COEP is renowned for its excellent faculty, state-of-the-art infrastructure, and vibrant campus life.

MIT World Peace University

MIT World Peace University is known for its holistic approach to education. The university emphasizes peace studies along with engineering education. With a strong focus on research and innovation, MIT WPU provides a wide range of undergraduate and postgraduate engineering programs. The campus is equipped with modern facilities and offers numerous opportunities for student engagement.

Vishwakarma Institute of Technology

Vishwakarma Institute of Technology is a private engineering college affiliated with Savitribai Phule Pune University. The institute offers a variety of engineering courses and is known for its strong industry connections. Students benefit from practical learning experiences and have access to well-equipped laboratories and research centers.

Symbiosis Institute of Technology

Symbiosis Institute of Technology is part of the Symbiosis International University. The institute offers undergraduate and postgraduate programs in engineering with a focus on creating industry-ready professionals. The campus provides a conducive learning environment with advanced facilities and resources.

Bharati Vidyapeeth Deemed University

Bharati Vidyapeeth Deemed University is a prestigious institution offering a range of engineering programs. The university has a strong emphasis on research and development, with numerous collaborations with industry and academia. The campus is equipped with modern amenities and provides a supportive environment for students.

Dr. D.Y. Patil Institute of Technology

Dr. D.Y. Patil Institute of Technology offers comprehensive engineering programs with a focus on practical learning. The institute has well-established industry partnerships, providing students with ample internship and placement opportunities. The campus boasts state-of-the-art infrastructure and facilities.

Maharashtra Institute of Technology

Maharashtra Institute of Technology is a leading engineering college in Pune, known for its quality education and research initiatives. The institute offers various engineering programs and has a strong focus on innovation and entrepreneurship. The campus provides a dynamic learning environment with excellent facilities.

Pimpri Chinchwad College of Engineering

Pimpri Chinchwad College of Engineering is affiliated with Savitribai Phule Pune University. The college offers a range of engineering programs and is known for its academic excellence. Students have access to modern laboratories, research centers, and a supportive learning environment.

Army Institute of Technology

Army Institute of Technology is an engineering college exclusively for children of army personnel. The institute offers quality engineering education with a focus on discipline and values. The campus is well-equipped with modern facilities and provides a conducive environment for academic growth.

Sinhgad College of Engineering

Sinhgad College of Engineering is affiliated with Savitribai Phule Pune University and offers various undergraduate and postgraduate engineering programs. The college is known for its strong academic framework, experienced faculty, and excellent infrastructure. Students benefit from a range of extracurricular activities and industry exposure.

Top ranking 2024 B.Tech Colleges in Pune

The table below provides detailed information about some of the leading B.Tech colleges in Pune:

1).College of Engineering, Pune :

COEP Pune was established in 1854 and now is known as COEP Technological University. Located in Pune, the unitary public university of the government of Maharashtra, through 14 departments, offers UG, PG, and PhD courses to students. These courses are provided across Management, Planning, and various other streams. The university is accredited by the NBA and is ranked 73 by NIRF 2023 under the Engineering category. COEP Pune offers flagship courses such as BTech and MTech.

2).Army Institute of Technology, Pune

Army Institute of Technology, a prestigious higher education institution, was founded in 1994. The institute offers UG and PG Degree programmes for students to further their studies. These programs are specially designed for Full-Time mode and are approved by prominent national bodies such as AICTE. The institute offers a variety of courses such as B.E. / B.Tech, M.E./M.Tech in major streams including Engineering. Army Institute of Technology provides its students with top-notch education delivered by its skilled and experienced faculty in the fields of Mechanical Engineering, Computer Science Engineering, Electronics & Communication Engineering, Information Technology.

3).MIT World Peace University, Pune

Established in 2017, MIT World Peace University is a private university located in Kothrud, Pune. With 150+ programs in Management, Engineering, Design, and more, MIT-WPU consistently ranks among the country’s top universities MIT Pune is a part of MAEER’s MIT Group of Institutions. MIT World Peace University-School of Engineering is accredited by NBA. MIT WPU, through various schools of study, offers UG, PG, diploma, certificate, and other courses to students across the Management, Engineering, Design, and other streams. Maharashtra Institute of Technology has been ranked 94 under the ‘Pharmacy’ category by the NIRF in 2023

4).DY Patil School of Engineering and Technology

Established in 2011, Dr DY Patil School of Engineering and Technology (also known as DYPSOET) is one of the premier Engineering School located in ‘Oxford of the east’, Maharashtra. The School comes under the purview of Dr DY Patil Technical Campus (DYPTC). The School has been approved by the All India Council for Technical Education (AICTE) and the Directorate of Technical Education Government of Maharashtra (DTE GoM). Also, it is affiliated to Savitribai Phule Pune University (SPPU) and is accredited with ‘B++’ grade by the National Assessment and Accreditation Council (NAAC).

5).All India Shri Shivaji Memorial Society’s Institute of Information Technology

All India Shri Shivaji Memorial Society’s Institute of Information Technology, a prestigious higher education institution, was founded in 1999. The institute offers UG and PG Degree programmes for students to further their studies. These programs are specially designed for Full-Time mode and are approved by prominent national bodies such as AICTE. The institute offers a variety of courses such as B.E. / B.Tech, M.E./M.Tech in major streams including Engineering. All India Shri Shivaji Memorial Society’s Institute of Information Technology provides its students with top-notch education delivered by its skilled and experienced faculty in the fields of Computer Science Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Electronics Engineering, Instrumentation Technology, Information Technology.

6).Zeal College Of Engineering and Research Pune

Established in 2007, Zeal College of Engineering and Research (also known as ZCOER) is a highly-ranked Engineering college situated in Pune. The College is founded by Zeal Education’s Society and is affiliated with Savitribai Phule Pune University (SPPU). ZCOER has been approved by the All India Council of Technical Education (AICTE) and accredited by the National Assessment and Accreditation Council (NAAC) and Internal Quality Assurance Cell (IQAC). Zeal Education Society runs eight institutes in total, offering education from pre-primary to PhD courses.

ROI of Top Engineering Colleges in Pune

The Return on Investment (ROI) is a comparison between the tuition fees paid by engineering students during their overall engineering course and the returns they receive in the form of job placements.

The College of Engineering Pune stands out by offering the highest average salary package compared to its overall course fee.

Below, you’ll find a list of the top engineering colleges in Pune with details on their annual fees and packages.

Eligibility Criteria of the Best Engineering Colleges in Pune

Listed below are the eligibility criteria that candidates need to meet in order to seek admission into the best engineering colleges in Pune:

To be eligible for admission, students should secure at least 60% in aggregate in their Class 12 examinations with Physics, Chemistry, and Mathematics as their core subjects.

The admission process typically involves clearing the college entrance examination, followed by counselling and seat allocation rounds.

Some colleges in Pune consider merit-based admissions, and, in certain cases, they accept standardised test scorecards such as JEE Main, JEE Advanced, and others for BTech admissions.

Entrance Examinations Accepted by Leading Engineering Colleges in Pune

For engineering courses in Pune, candidates are required to qualify for specific entrance examinations, which include:

1. JEE Main: JEE Main is a crucial examination for admission to BE/BTech, BArch, and BPlan programs at NITs, IIITs, and other Centrally Funded Technical Institutes (CFTIs). Also, it is a prerequisite for admission to institutions/universities supported or recognised by participating State Governments.

Qualifying in JEE Main is also a stepping stone for the JEE Advanced, which determines admission to IITs. Candidates preparing for this examination can access JEE Main previous year papers for preparation and a better understanding of the test. Practising JEE Main past papers from at least ten years ago provides valuable insights into various exam components, including frequently covered topics and difficulty levels.

College of Engineering Pune (COEP): Public college, NIRF #7 Engineering rank, excellent faculty, strong alumni network, competitive admissions.

Symbiosis Institute of Technology (SIT): Deemed university, NIRF #55 Engineering rank, known for its strong industry connections, international exposure, and diverse courses.

Vishwakarma Institute of Technology (VIT): Public college, NIRF #214 Engineering rank, well-established, good infrastructure, diverse specializations.

Dr. Vishwanath Karad MIT World Peace University: Private university, good reputation, offers various scholarships.

Bharati Vidyapeeth Deemed University College of Engineering (BVUCOEP): Deemed university, NIRF #91 Engineering rank, known for its placements and practical learning.

Pune Institute of Computer Technology (PICT): Deemed university, known for its focus on computer science and IT, strong placements.

Maharashtra Institute of Technology (MIT Maharashtra): Public college, good faculty, focus on research and innovation.

2. MHT CET: The Maharashtra Common Entrance Test (MHT CET) is a state-level entrance examination used to select candidates for admission to engineering and pharmacy programs offered by various colleges in Maharashtra. This annual examination is conducted by the Maharashtra State Common Entrance Test Cell.

College of Engineering Pune (COEP): NIRF Ranking: 17 . One of the most prestigious engineering colleges in India with a strong alumni network. Offers a wide range of undergraduate and postgraduate engineering programs.

Maharashtra Institute of Technology (MIT): NIRF Ranking: 22. Renowned for its quality education and research in engineering disciplines. Spacious campus with modern facilities and laboratories.

Symbiosis Institute of Technology (SIT): NIRF Ranking: 45. Part of the renowned Symbiosis International University. Emphasis on interdisciplinary learning and global exposure.

Pune Institute of Computer Technology (PICT): NIRF Ranking: 77 . Leading institute in computer science and information technology education. Strong focus on practical learning and entrepreneurship.

Sinhgad College of Engineering (SCOET): NIRF Ranking: 109. One of the largest and most reputed engineering colleges in Pune. Offers a diverse range of engineering programs.

3. GATE: This is a graduate-level examination conducted in India that primarily tests the comprehensive understanding of various undergraduate subjects in Engineering and Science for admission into postgraduate programs (Master’s degree) and recruitment by some Public Sector Companies (PSUs).

Defence Institute of Advanced Technology (DIAT): NIRF Ranking #16. Premier institute for defence and aerospace engineering in India. Offers M.Tech programs in various specializations like Aerospace Engineering, Electronics and Communication Engineering, and Computer Science and Engineering.

College of Engineering Pune (COEP): NIRF Ranking #17. One of the most prestigious engineering colleges in India with a strong alumni network. Offers a wide range of M.Tech programs across various engineering disciplines.

Dr. D. Y. Patil Institute of Technology and Research (DYPIT): NIRF Ranking #55. Renowned for its quality education and research in engineering and technology. Offers M.Tech programs in various specializations like Computer Science and Engineering, Electronics and Communication Engineering, and Mechanical Engineering.

Bharati Vidyapeeth Deemed University College of Engineering (BVDU): NIRF Ranking #81. A leading deemed university with a strong focus on engineering education. Offers M.Tech programs in various specializations like Computer Science and Engineering, Electronics and Communication Engineering, and Civil Engineering.

Vishwakarma Institute of Technology (VIT): NIRF Ranking #84. Renowned for its focus on practical learning and skill development in engineering. Offers M.Tech programs in various specializations like Computer Science and Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, and Production and Industrial Engineering.

Leading Employers for BTech Graduates in Pune

Given the increasing demand for BTech graduates in Pune, students in both private and public colleges receive outstanding placement offers. Within the top 10 engineering colleges in Pune, here’s a compilation of the best BTech institutions and their list of prominent recruiters:

Conclusion

The engineering colleges listed above are some of the best in Pune that believe in the holistic development of a student. They look after future leaders who will help society develop with their knowledge. With these engineering institutes in Pune, students can expect a successful career in the engineering field ahead. Stay tuned with us for such more updates!

Best Engineering Colleges in Pune 2024 – FAQs

Which Engineering branch is best in Pune?

The best department at MIT Pune, in my opinion, is Electronics and Communication Engineering. The primary causes are: Excellent faculty, with 85% of the professors holding PhDs and the remaining 15% working towards one. The majority of them have extensive experience working in the industry.

Which Engineering college has lowest fees in Pune?

With total tuition fees ranging from INR 7 Lacs to INR 17 lacs, MIT World Peace University has the highest total cost, while COEP has the lowest, at INR 75,000.

Is Pune Good for Engineering?

The best alternative is to attend a much more expensive college in Mumbai, where one can avoid paying the additional costs of housing, which are typically much higher in this case.

Which engineering college in Pune has the best placement?

Army Institute of Technology has the best placement record till now with an annual average salary package of INR 5.5 lakh -INR 8 lakh.
